name: Beef Bhuna
ingredients: beef, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt, oil
cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. 2. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a few seconds. 3. Add the beef and fry until browned. 4. Add the tomatoes, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, and salt, and stir well. 5. Cover and simmer until the beef is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

name: Fish Curry
ingredients: fish, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt, oil
cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. 2. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a few seconds. 3. Add the fish and fry until lightly browned. 4. Add the tomatoes, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, and salt, and stir well. 5. Cover and simmer until the fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

name: Chicken Korma
ingredients: chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, yogurt, cream, almond, raisin, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt, oil
cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown. 2. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a few seconds. 3. Add the chicken and fry until lightly browned. 4. Add the yogurt, cream, almonds, raisins, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, and salt, and stir well. 5. Cover and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.

name: Shorshe Ilish
ingredients: hilsa fish, mustard seed, onion, garlic, chili, turmeric, salt, oil
cooking_method: 1. Grind mustard seeds and chili to a paste. 2. Fry onions and garlic in oil until browned. 3. Add the mustard paste, turmeric, and salt, and stir well. 4. Add the fish and cook until done.

name: Chitol Macher Muitha
ingredients: chitol fish, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt, oil, flour, egg
cooking_method: 1. Boil the fish and remove the bones. 2. Fry onions, garlic, and ginger until browned. 3. Add the chili, coriander 4. cook for some minute and done

name: Chingri Bhapa
ingredients: shrimp, onion, garlic, ginger, coconut milk, mustard oil, green chili, salt
cooking_method: 1. Mix shrimp, onion, garlic, ginger, green chili and salt in a bowl. 2. Add coconut milk and mustard oil, mix well. 3. Place the mixture in a container, cover it and steam it for 15-20 minutes until the shrimp are cooked. Serve hot with rice.

name: Bhuna Khichuri
ingredients: rice, lentils, onion, garlic, ginger, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, ghee, salt
cooking_method: 1. Soak the lentils and rice for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pot and add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, and cumin seeds. 3. Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, and chili powder and stir. 5. Add the soaked lentils and rice, and stir. 6. Add water, cover and cook until the rice and lentils are soft. 7. Serve hot with a dollop of ghee on top.

name: Pitha
ingredients: rice flour, jaggery, grated coconut, cardamom powder, salt, water
cooking_method: 1. Mix rice flour, jaggery, grated coconut, cardamom powder, and salt in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually and knead the mixture to form a dough. 3. Make small balls from the dough and flatten them to form circular discs. 4. Heat a griddle and cook the pitha on both sides until golden brown. 5. Serve hot.

name: Shorshe Ilish
ingredients: Hilsa fish, onion, garlic, ginger, mustard oil, green chili, black mustard seeds, salt, turmeric powder
cooking_method: 1. Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder. 2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. 3. Remove the fish from the pan and keep it aside. 4. Add black mustard seeds, chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili to the same pan and sauté for a few minutes. 5. Add water and bring it to a boil. 6. Add the fried fish to the pan and simmer for a few minutes. 7. Serve hot with rice.

name: Bhapa Pitha
ingredients: rice flour, coconut, jaggery, salt, water
cooking_method: 1. Mix rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, and salt in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually and knead the mixture to form a dough. 3. Make small balls from the dough and flatten them to form circular discs. 4. Grease a container with oil and place the flattened discs in it. 5. Steam the pitha for 10-15 minutes until cooked. 6. Serve hot.

name: Luchi
ingredients: wheat flour, oil, salt, water, baking powder, beshon, dal, dhania,Potato
cooking_method: 1. Mix wheat flour, salt, and oil in a bowl. 2. Add water gradually and knead the mixture to form a smooth dough. 3. Make small balls from the dough and roll them into circular discs. 4. Heat oil in a pan and fry the luchi until puffed and golden brown. 5. Serve hot with aloo dum or chholar dal.

name: Chingri Malaikari
ingredients: prawns, onion, garlic, ginger, coconut milk, mustard oil, green chili, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, sugar
cooking_method: 1. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the prawns until golden brown. 2. Remove the prawns from the pan and keep it aside. 3. Add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili to the same pan and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, and turmeric powder and stir. 5. Add coconut milk, salt, and sugar and bring it to a boil. 6. Add the fried prawns to the pan and simmer for a few minutes. 7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Chitol Maach Bhuna
ingredients: Chitol fish, potatoes, ginger, green chili, mustard oil, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, sugar
cooking_method: 1. Boil the fish until cooked and remove the bones. 2. Mash the fish and mix it with boiled potatoes, chopped ginger, and green chili. 3. Make small balls from the mixture. 4. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, and cumin seeds. 5. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, and sugar and stir. 6. Add water and bring it to a boil. 7. Add the fish balls to the pan and simmer for a few minutes. 8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Khichuri
ingredients: rice, lentil, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, ghee
cooking_method: 1. Wash rice and lentil and soak them for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee in a pot and add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger. 3. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and chili powder and stir. 4. Add the soaked rice and lentil to the pot and stir. 5. Add water and salt and bring it to a boil. 6. Simmer until the rice and lentil are cooked. 7. Serve hot with fried eggplant or potato and papadum.

name: Morog Polao
ingredients: basmati rice, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, yogurt, green chili, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cardamom, cloves, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, saffron, ghee, salt, sugar
cooking_method: 1. Marinate the chicken with yogurt, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt for at least 4 hours. 2. Heat ghee in a pot and add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cardamom, and cloves. 3. Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add the marinated chicken to the pot and stir. 5. Add water and salt and bring it to a boil. 6. Add soaked rice to the pot and stir. 7. Add saffron and sugar and cover the pot. 8. Simmer until the rice and chicken are cooked. 9. Serve hot with raita and salad.

name: Puli Pitha
ingredients: rice flour, jaggery, coconut, sesame seeds, salt, water
cooking_method: 1. Mix rice flour, salt, and water in a bowl to form a smooth batter. 2. Make small balls from the batter and flatten them into circular discs. 3. Fill each disc with grated coconut and jaggery mixture and fold it to form a half-moon shape. 4. Press the edges to seal the pitha. 5. Boil water in a pot and add the pitha. 6. Cook until the pitha floats to the surface. 7. Remove from water and coat with sesame seeds. 8. Serve hot or at room temperature.

name: Chingri Malaikari
ingredients: prawns, onion, garlic, ginger, coconut milk, mustard oil, green chili, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, salt, sugar
cooking_method: 1. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the prawns until golden brown. 2. Remove the prawns from the pan and keep it aside. 3. Add chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili to the same pan and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, and turmeric powder and stir. 5. Add coconut milk, salt, and sugar and bring it to a boil. 6. Add the fried prawns to the pan and simmer for a few minutes. 7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Tihari
ingredients: basmati rice, Beef,Radhuni Tihari Masala, onion, garlic, ginger, yogurt, green chili, bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cardamom, cloves, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, saffron, ghee, salt, sugar
cooking_method: 1. Marinate the Beef with yogurt, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt for at least 4 hours. 2. Heat ghee in a pot and add bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cardamom, and cloves. 3. Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for a few minutes. 4. Add the marinated chicken to the pot and stir. 5. Add water and salt and bring it to a boil. 6. Add soaked rice to the pot and stir. 7. Add saffron and sugar and cover the pot. 8. Simmer until the rice and chicken are cooked. 9. Serve hot with raita and salad.
